means: 受困惑地，混乱地，慌乱地

sentence.Network_cn: 他迷惑不解地摇了摇头。

sentence.Network_en: He moved nervously about, while Carrie looked at him confusedly.
sentence.Network_cn: 他紧张不安地在屋里走来走去.嘉莉在一旁狼狈地看着他.

sentence.Network_en: I fell, to the ground before her, babbling confusedly in my terror.
sentence.Network_cn: 我吓得瘫倒在她面前, 语无伦次地嗫嚅起来.

“我都不明了当时何如想的，会稀里糊涂(Confusedly)去拿钱。理想首先是一种付出，然后才是收获。”21日上昼，看待拿钱的出处，对 …

entry.def: If you are confused, you do not know exactly what is happening or what to do.

example.ex: A survey showed people were confused about what they should eat to stay healthy...
example.tran: 一项调查表明，人们对该吃什么才能保持健康这个问题感到困惑。

example.ex: Things were happening too quickly and Brian was confused.
example.tran: 事情发生得太快，把布赖恩给弄糊涂了。

entry.def: Something that is confused does not have any order or pattern and is difficult to understand.

example.ex: The situation remains confused as both sides claim success.
example.tran: 由于双方均宣称获胜，形势依然不明朗。

example.ex: ...a modern society in which values have become increasingly confused.
example.tran: 价值观变得越来越混乱的现代社会

sentences.sentence: "Queen Augusta wrote him an hysterical letter in which she confusedly sympathised with him"

auth_sentence.content: They look around confusedly, then stare at me in dismay.
auth_sentence.res_content: They look around confusedly, then stare at me in dismay.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: They look around confusedly, then stare at me in dismay.
